those_dizzying_no_spin_serves.probleme: Difficulty in attacking a low, heavy backspin serve
causes_communes: Opponent digging into the serve and pushing it back low and heavy
Looping with heavy topspin to convert opponent's backspin into topspin

debutant.nom: developing a good sidepin or topspin serve

intermediaire.description: Develop a no-spin serve as a variation to your spin serves, and learn to really load up the ball with so much no-spin that no opponent can possibly overcome that dizzying lack of spin you throw at them.

exercices_complementaires.description: Serve the ball near the handle, where the racket is moving slowly, to get an almost spinless ball.

erreurs_a_eviter.nom: not serving the ball low to the net
erreurs_a_eviter.description: Serve no-spin very low to the net, so that it's difficult for an opponent to flip aggressively.
